entry.et: Middle English sise assize, from Anglo-French, short for assise assize

def.dt: :assize 2a usually used in plural
:a fixed portion of food or drink
:physical magnitude, extent, or bulk :relative or proportionate dimensions
:relative aggregate amount or number
:considerable proportions :bigness
:one of a series of graduated measures especially of manufactured articles (as of clothing) conventionally identified by numbers or letters a size seven hat
:character, quality, or status of a person or thing especially with reference to importance, relative merit, or correspondence to needs try this idea on for size
:actual state of affairs that's about the size of it
:to make a particular size :bring to proper or suitable size
:to arrange, grade, or classify according to size or bulk
:to equal in size or other particular characteristic :compare usually used with up and often with to or with
:sized usually used in combination

:any of various glutinous materials (as preparations of glue, flour, varnish, or resins) used for filling the pores in surfaces (as of paper, textiles, leather, or plaster) or for applying color or metal leaf (as to book edges or covers)
:to cover, stiffen, or glaze with or as if with size
:to form a judgment of size up the situation
:of a size that can be eaten in one bite bite–size pieces of chicken
:being or made small or brief especially so as to be easily manageable bite–size tasks bite–size essays
:having the usual or normal size of its kind
:having the dimensions 54 by 75 inches (about 1.4 by 1.9 meters) used of a bed compare king-size queen-size twin-size
:longer than the regular or standard size a king–size cigarette
:unusually large
:having dimensions of approximately 76 by 80 inches (about 1.9 by 2.0 meters) used of a bed compare full-size queen-size twin-size
:of a size that fits a king-size bed king–size sheets
:of natural size :of the size of the original a life–size statue
